perturbation.original_text: The Supplier wishes to appoint the Distributor as its non-exclusive distributor for the promotion and sale of the Products within the Territory (both as defined below), and the Distributor wishes to promote and sell the Products within the Territory on the terms of this agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: The Supplier wishes to appoint the Vendor as its non-exclusive distributor for the promotion and sale of the Goods within the Territory (both as defined below), and the Distributor wishes to promote and sell the Products within the Territory on the terms of this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Distributor' is replaced with 'Vendor' when the 'Supplier' wishes to appoint. The text defines the arrangement differently, potentially causing confusion about the relationship and responsibilities, specifically who is responsible for promotion of the products ('Vendor' or 'Distributor').

perturbation.original_text: 5. Prices and payment 5.1 The prices to be paid by the Distributor to the Supplier for the Products are to be the Price, as set out in Schedule 4. 5.2 Any and all expenses, costs and charges incurred by the Distributor in the performance of its obligations under this agreement will be paid by the Distributor, unless the Supplier has expressly agreed in advance in writing to pay such expenses, costs and charges. 5.3 The Distributor must pay the full amount invoiced to it by the Supplier in USD$'s within thirty (45) days of the date of invoice.
perturbation.changed_text: 5. Prices and payment 5.1 The prices to be paid by the Retailer to the Supplier for the Products are to be the Price, as set out in Schedule 4. 5.2 Any and all expenses, costs and charges incurred by the Distributor in the performance of its obligations under this agreement will be paid by the Distributor, unless the Supplier has expressly agreed in advance in writing to pay such expenses, costs and charges. 5.3 The Purchaser must pay the full amount invoiced to it by the Supplier in USD$'s within thirty (45) days of the date of invoice.
perturbation.explanation: In section 5.1, 'Distributor' is replaced by 'Retailer,' suggesting that the entity paying the price is the Retailer, but the payment is mentioned on 'Distributor' and 'Purchaser'. This creates confusion as to who is responsible for making the payments and if these are different entities or not. This inconsistency might lead to disputes about payment obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 10. Product liability and insurance 10.1 Subject to the Distributor fulfilling all the conditions in this clause 10, the Supplier shall indemnify the Distributor, defend and hold harmless against any liability incurred by the Distributor in respect of damage to property, death or personal injury arising from any fault or defect in the design of the Products and any reasonable costs, claims, demands and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, arising out of or in connection with that liability (Relevant Claim), except to the extent the liability arises as a result of the wilful misconduct of the Distributor. The Supplier shall add the distributor to their current insurance certificate.
perturbation.changed_text: 10. Product liability and insurance 10.1 Subject to the Client fulfilling all the conditions in this clause 10, the Supplier shall indemnify the Representative, defend and hold harmless against any liability incurred by the Representative in respect of damage to property, death or personal injury arising from any fault or defect in the design of the Products and any reasonable costs, claims, demands and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, arising out of or in connection with that liability (Relevant Claim), except to the extent the liability arises as a result of the wilful misconduct of the Distributor. The Supplier shall add the distributor to their current insurance certificate.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Distributor' is changed to 'Client' and 'Representative.' This contradicts the previous definition, introducing doubt about who bears the responsibility for product-related liabilities and whose behavior might affect the Supplier's indemnity obligations. Further, the insurance certificate should be added to whom? 'distributor', 'Client', or 'Representative'?
